title.narrative: End OSEC: A model for response to online sexual exploitation of children

description.narrative:
Enable the Philippine children protection program for Online Sexual Exploitation of Children (OSEC) to protect children and better victims’ access to the judicial system.
Avoiding future OSEC through changing national and local laws.
Assistance to the authorities in saving children from exploitation. The victims are relocated to safe housing away from harm.
Rehabilitation of victims or possible victims of OSEC.

The grant is given to the organisation due to their application to the COVID-19 Emergency Pool (Nødpulje) in order for the organisation to continue their activities of ending OSEC in the Philippines. Due to COVID-19 restrictions, planned development activities is in risk of closure, which would negatively affect results.
Strategic objectives:
The goal of the End OSEC project is to prevent OSEC through changing and adapting laws, assisting authorities in saving exploited children, and rehabilitating victims in order for them to get back a normal childhood.
